http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv-community.gif http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif ADMIN-SLC List ADMIN-SLC List Archives https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?RSS&L=ADMIN-SLC&v=ATOM1.0
This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=ADMIN-SLC.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-06T09:56:13Z Place, Sally 2015-03-06T09:56:08+00:00 2015-03-06T09:56:08+00:00 Re: Part Time Course Submission https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-SLC;a1da815f.1503 Hi,<br><br>Yes we did at Teesside.<br><br>Sally<br><br>From: List for discussions regarding Student Loans Company and Bursaries [mailto:ADMIN-SLC@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Daniel Lockley<br>Sent: 05 March 2015 14:09<br>To: ADMIN-SLC@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: Part Time Course Submission<br><br>Could I just ask did anybody get an email to indicate the part time course submission was open?<br><br>Kind regards<br><br>Daniel<br><br>Daniel Lockley<br>Student Funding,<br>Student Education Service,<br>University of Leeds,<br>Leeds, LS2 9JT [...] Mary Bryce 2015-03-05T16:04:23+00:00 2015-03-05T16:04:23+00:00 Mary Bryce/SLC is out of the office. https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-SLC;8ac6450d.1503 I will be out of the office starting 27/02/2015 and will not return until<br>09/03/2015.<br><br>Please wait until my return. Alternatively , you may contact Karen<br>Urquhart on 0141 243 3450 Lesley Dixon 2015-03-05T14:12:39+00:00 2015-03-05T14:12:39+00:00 Re: Part Time Course Submission https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-SLC;83380f9d.1503 Yes<br><br>From: Graeme Lindsay [mailto:Graeme_Lindsay@slc.co.uk] On Behalf Of HEP Services<br>Sent: 04 March 2015 13:17<br>Subject: NEWSFLASH : COURSES MANAGEMENT SERVICE<br><br>Dear Colleagues,<br><br>The Courses Management Service is now live and available for all publicly funded, Higher Education Providers to commence their Part Time course information for the 2015/16 academic year.<br><br>We would encourage you to access the service and check your provider details which will now be populated with your Part Time Fee cap and if you wish, set up further locations. The service can be accessed through the HE Portal hosted on the HEP Services website or via [...] Daniel Lockley 2015-03-05T14:08:33+00:00 2015-03-05T14:08:33+00:00 Re: Part Time Course Submission https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-SLC;7d5eeb8f.1503 Could I just ask did anybody get an email to indicate the part time course submission was open?<br><br>Kind regards<br><br>Daniel<br><br>Daniel Lockley<br>Student Funding,<br>Student Education Service,<br>University of Leeds,<br>Leeds, LS2 9JT<br><br>Tel (0113) 3434124<br><br>From: List for discussions regarding Student Loans Company and Bursaries [mailto:ADMIN-SLC@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Ireland, Jacque<br>Sent: 05 March 2015 11:48<br>To: ADMIN-SLC@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Part Time Course Submission [...] Karen Senior 2015-03-05T12:10:23+00:00 2015-03-05T12:10:23+00:00 Re: Part Time Course Submission https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-SLC;39277c35.1503 Further info:<br><br>I have just spoken to our SLC Relationship Manager, and she advised that because of the new ELQ policy around funding for part-time students we will need to apply a subject category to each course. This is because the subject that a student chooses to study will ascertain whether they are eligible for funding on a second degree. We are thinking of grouping these where possible, ie Business Management courses with various strands (HR, Tourism, Accounting etc) could be categorised with one 'Business Management' course entry. [...] Karen Senior 2015-03-05T11:54:40+00:00 2015-03-05T11:54:40+00:00 Re: Part Time Course Submission https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-SLC;c3b71a65.1503 Hi Jacque,<br><br>I have just emailed my Relationship Manager with that very same question. We have used generic titles for this current academic year (2014/15) because we only tend to have a very small number of part-time undergraduate students. Therefore for us, the generic titles are more convenient and less time-consuming. However, they do sometimes cause issues with matching as you say, so we've asked for further guidance to help us decide the best way forward. I'd be really interested to hear what everyone else is doing too. [...] Ireland, Jacque 2015-03-05T11:48:23+00:00 2015-03-05T11:48:23+00:00 Part Time Course Submission https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-SLC;47e22c89.1503 Has anyone started to add their part time courses to the CMS database yet? Just wondering if you are adding them with generic titles as suggested by the SLC or if you are going back to the full description? In the past we have used generic titles which has caused all sorts of problems with matching so I am considering changing to full titles but would like to know if this is any better before we channel a lot of time and effort in to changing. [...] Pearman, Elroy 2015-02-25T10:25:38+00:00 2015-02-25T10:25:38+00:00 Re: SLC Stakeholder Group report https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-SLC;62c967f5.1502 Hi,<br><br>Yes, I agree it is misleading \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd I went to a Welsh HEI Forum and mentioned it there, as the SLC thought we\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdd only submitted 38% and still had a lot of courses to submit when in fact we only had our Franchise courses to add. We reduced from 269 courses down to 102. [...] Marian Hilditch 2015-02-25T09:53:09+00:00 2015-02-25T09:53:09+00:00 Re: SLC Stakeholder Group report https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-SLC;52d59a0c.1502 Thank you for the feedback here and privately.<br><br>We've all said the same thing, which is reassuring.<br><br>Ray's report is on the SROC website as well now, for those who don't use<br>Linkedin:<br><br>http://www.sroc.ac.uk/blog-detail.php?id=41<br><br>Best wishes Daniel Lockley 2015-02-25T09:47:38+00:00 2015-02-25T09:47:38+00:00 Re: SLC Stakeholder Group report https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-SLC;4f3014b2.1502 Morning,<br><br>I think that statistic could be a little misleading as it may include (or may not I don\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt know) private HEPs whose courses need approval so may not yet be added.<br><br>More importantly I believe the statistic is based on a comparison between the total number of courses entered last year vs the number entered this year after almost all institutions have simplified and cleaned up their databases. As an example we only entered around 1100 instead of 1400 so just under 80% of the courses SFE would have \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdexpected\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. [...] Rod Peet 2015-02-19T12:38:05+00:00 2015-02-19T12:38:05+00:00 Survey of SLC service and balances outstanding https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-SLC;e869b7b7.1502 Dear Colleagues,<br><br>We are currently collecting data in order to help identify where the SLC<br>and institutions are owed money relating to student tuition fees and to<br>quantify the extent of any problems. Whilst respondents so far indicate<br>that SLC service has improved, some are also finding that institutions have<br>problems of their own and this has been a catalyst to look at processes and<br>procedures. [...] Marian Hilditch 2015-02-16T12:40:57+00:00 2015-02-16T12:40:57+00:00 SLC Stakeholder Group report https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-SLC;a0e32607.1502 The SROC LinkedIn group has been updated with feedback from the latest SLC<br>Stakeholder Group which I thought might be of interest:<br><br>Report from latest SLC Stakeholder Operations Group Meeting<br><https://www.linkedin.com/groupAnswers?viewQuestionAndAnswers=&discussionID=5973038443352059904&gid=2443715&goback=%2Enmp_*1_*1_*1_*1_*1_*1_*1_*1_*1_*1_*1_*1_*1_*1#commentID_null><br><br>Particularly the first point:<br><br>1. The group were informed that only 61% of Courses had been uploaded live<br>onto the HEI portal as at 28th January, 2015 in readiness for the<br>applications from students for 2015/16 to be submitted. The application<br>portal is now live and concerns have been raised at the Stakeholder Forum<br>held in London on 28th January, 2015 regarding the level of outstanding<br>courses requiring to [...] Deborah Clark 2015-02-16T12:23:45+00:00 2015-02-16T12:23:45+00:00 Re: Students unable to see courses on CMS https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-SLC;137c0dbb.1502 We\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdve had just one instance where the student couldn\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt find the course when we could see it so we referred them back to SF but other than that it\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds been ok up to now although its early days (fingers crossed).<br><br>Deborah Clark | Graduate Student Funding Officer | Student Services Centre | Directorate for the Student Experience| The University of Manchester | Oxford Road | Manchester M13 9PL | Tel. +44 (0) 161 275 5000 (option 5) | Fax + 44 (0) 161 275 7860 |Working Hours Monday - Friday 9am - 5pm | www.manchester.ac.uk<http://www.manchester.ac.uk/> : http://www.manchester.ac.uk/crucialguide/<br>[cid:image001.jpg@01CD17C8.E06E5E80]<http://www.facebook.com/studentservicescentre><br>P Please [...] Melissa Cadby 2015-02-16T11:16:57+00:00 2015-02-16T11:16:57+00:00 Re: Students unable to see courses on CMS https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-SLC;8b1e7506.1502 Dear all<br><br>We\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdve now started to have problems with this \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd one applicant phoned SFE to be told that her course (which we have run for a number of years) wasn\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt eligible for funding which worried her. The SFE advisor then told her that her institution need to \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdrefresh their server\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd which wasn\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt particularly helpful either!! [...] Emma Lisette (PLN) 2015-02-06T10:56:54+00:00 2015-02-06T10:56:54+00:00 Re: Students unable to see courses on CMS https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-SLC;1a1b77c9.1502 Hello<br><br>Yes we are finding this too, as well as the wrong information appearing when students are searching for the course but we can't see anything wrong on CMS.<br><br>Best wishes<br><br>Emma Lisette<br>SLC Liaison<br>Planning Office, The Registry<br>University of East Anglia<br>Norwich Research Park<br>NR4 7TJ<br>Tel: 01603 592769<br>Email: slc.liaison@uea.ac.uk<br>Personal Email: emma.lisette@uea.ac.uk<br>Twitter: @UEASLCLiaison<br><br>[cid:BBD3E578-AEC1-42AF-A718-2381FE5EA87C]<http://www.uea.ac.uk/><br><br>From: List for discussions regarding Student Loans Company and Bursaries [mailto:ADMIN-SLC@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Boswell, Lauren<br>Sent: Tuesday, February 03, 2015 10:56 AM<br>To: ADMIN-SLC@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Students unable to see courses on CMS [...] Pippa Smith 2015-02-03T11:47:17+00:00 2015-02-03T11:47:17+00:00 Re: Students unable to see courses on CMS https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-SLC;13118e74.1502 Dear Lauren<br>Yes we have.<br>Best wishes, Pippa Boswell, Lauren 2015-02-03T10:55:49+00:00 2015-02-03T10:55:49+00:00 Students unable to see courses on CMS https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-SLC;6e71185a.1502 Morning<br><br>We are having quite a few students contacting us to say that when they are making their funding application they are unable to find some of our courses on the new CMS even though when we check they are definitely on there.<br><br>We would like to know whether any other university is having the same issue. [...] Thorpe, Sara 2015-02-03T10:29:42+00:00 2015-02-03T10:29:42+00:00 Re: CMS dual non European language courses https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-SLC;a1cbac8d.1502 Hi there<br><br>Lancaster raised this as an issue last year as we also have courses with two compulsory placement years and the CMS, as you say, does not allow you to specify more than one placement year in the attributes. Early January we were advised that, although this is an enhancement they are looking in to, it is not likely to be imminent and so we should not use the placement attribute for these courses. Instead, we should adjust the fees and dates accordingly for those years and indicate in the course title which are the placement years. [...] Marian Hilditch 2015-02-03T10:15:51+00:00 2015-02-03T10:15:51+00:00 Re: CMS dual non European language courses https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-SLC;bfa3197f.1502 Daniel<br><br>We have a similar issue with courses where placements can be either year 3<br>or 4 and we were advised not to record the placement at all.<br><br>I'm concerned about the funding implications if the students themselves<br>haven't indicated they'll be on placement at time of application, but the<br>only alternative was to set up two different courses with different<br>placement years (not an option in your case) which I thought was worse. [...] Javed, Sam 2015-02-03T10:10:57+00:00 2015-02-03T10:10:57+00:00 Re: CMS dual non European language courses https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-SLC;69a1ec26.1502 Hi,<br><br>I have similar courses, so raised this with SLC and was told the following:<br><br>"This has currently been requested by several providers and we have raised it with the project team developing CMS as an enhancement. Currently if you just mark one year as a placement and we will hopefully be able to introduce this to allow you to mark the further year soon." [...] Valerie Jukes 2015-02-03T09:28:54+00:00 2015-02-03T09:28:54+00:00 Re: CMS dual non European language courses https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-SLC;48802c0b.1502 Hello Daniel<br>We have a similar problem with Business Administration and Architecture<br>where students are out for part-year placements in years 2 & 3 of a 4<br>year course. I raised this issue and was given the following reply from<br>the SLC:<br><br>"The placement attribute when checked on CMS prompts the provider to<br>indicate the one specific year that this placement is in relation to and<br>there is no functionality to select two years within the one single course. [...] Steve Anderson 2015-02-03T09:26:01+00:00 2015-02-03T09:26:01+00:00 Re: CMS dual non European language courses https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-SLC;d22cf968.1502 Daniel<br>Here at Northumbria we have some programmes where the placement straddles two academic years and I encountered the same problem.<br>Advice I was given by my Relationship manager was to not flag any year as a placement as the database "can't handle" courses with multiple placement years - so all we do is adjust the tuition fees for the "placement years" as we charge a lower tuition fee.<br>Hope this assists.<br>Steve Anderson [...] Daniel Lockley 2015-02-03T09:09:27+00:00 2015-02-03T09:09:27+00:00 CMS dual non European language courses https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-SLC;5a3da0e3.1502 Good Morning,<br><br>At Leeds we run courses such as Arabic and Chinese or Chinese and Russian where the student would have two placement years on the course so for example 5 years with 2 and 3 abroad.<br><br>In the new courses service it is impossible to put two placement flags on a course, I would just like to know if anybody else has come across this problem and how you dealt with it? [...]
